abstract: Pres Obama, despite a pledge not to take money from lobbyists, is relying on fund-raisers who are active lobbyists to raise millions of dollars for his re-election bid; at least 15 of Obama's 'bundlers', supporters who contribute their own money and solicit it from others, are involved in lobbying for Washington consulting shops or private companies; because bundlers are not registered as lobbyists with the Senate, Obama campaign has avoided running afoul of its self-imposed ban on taking money from lobbyists.
snippet: Despite a pledge not to take money from lobbyists, President Obama is relying on fund-raisers who are involved in lobbying for Washington consulting shops or private companies.
lead_paragraph: Despite a pledge not to take money from lobbyists, President Obama is relying on fund-raisers who are involved in lobbying for Washington consulting shops or private companies.

headline.main: Obama Backers Tied to Lobbies Raise Millions
headline.print_headline: Obama Backers Tied to Lobbies Raise Millions
